source.05707301:
There are several names can be use for the same gene, that causes some inconvinience. 
"HUGO" - is one the system of naming genes for HUmans. 

HUGO - is "HUman Genome Organization", it maintains human gene naming list/rules/etc
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_Genome_Organisation 

See here on HUGO rules for gene naming: 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HUGO_Gene_Nomenclature_Committee

See here for Wikipedia list of genes: 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_human_protein-coding_genes_1


See https://www.genenames.org/


File in current dataset contains info on 498 genes. Probably human (?). 
The scipt below loads them and just look some basic stats.
